  • Although visitors to your Hub won't be able to navigate to a hidden Stream organically (i.e. via the Hub menu), anyone who has the URL of the hidden Stream will still be able to access the Stream by visiting that URL.

 

Hide and Unhide a Stream

You can hide any Source or Marketing Stream - and unhide it again - at any time (DSRs are always hidden, and can't be unhidden.)

  1. Log in to Uberflip and navigate to the Hub which contains the Stream you want to hide.
  2. In the sidebar menu on the left, click on Content.
  3. In the Content menu on the right, you should be on the Streams tab. Scroll down to the Stream you want to hide and click on it to view it.
  4. When viewing the Stream, click on the "meatball" menu button near the top right:
  5. Click on Hide in the menu that appears:
  6. The Stream will be hidden immediately, and a message indicating that the Stream is hidden will appear just below the Stream name.
  7. To unhide a Stream, simply repeat the same steps, but click on Show in the meatball menu (which will appear in place of Hide) instead:
  8. Your changes will be saved automatically, and will take effect immediately.

articles.name: Reference: Uberflip IP Addresses
articles.title: Reference: Uberflip IP Addresses
articles.body:
A reference guide to the IP addresses used by Uberflip.

 

Usage

This reference guide lists the IP addresses used by Uberflip. These are the IP addresses that you will use to connect to Uberflip's servers, and which Uberflip's systems will use to connect to any services you host (if applicable).

This information is primarily useful for organizations which have IP restriction rules in place, e.g. an Allowed IP list that specifies the external IPs a device on your network can connect to, and/or the external IPs which may establish connections to devices on your network. Most commonly, such rules are implemented as part of a firewall or similar network security system.

Please note that we may make changes to our network infrastructure from time to time, so all IP addresses listed on this page are subject to change.

Caution

The IP addresses listed on this page should only be used for the purpose of configuring IP restriction rules. In all other instances where an Uberflip IP address might be applicable (e.g. when configuring DNS records or reverse proxy configurations for custom domains), you should always use the domain read.uberflip.com instead of an IP address.

 

Uberflip Inbound IPs

To access any Uberflip domain or service (including the Uberflip application), you must be able to connect to all of the following IP addresses:

52.60.165.183
52.60.160.16
3.98.63.202

If your organization restricts the IP addresses that devices on your network can connect to, you should ensure the IP addresses listed above are added to your Allowed IP list.

 

Uberflip Outbound IPs

The following IP addresses are used by Uberflip to establish connections to external (customer) systems:

35.182.205.201
35.182.103.172
3.96.250.25

If your organization hosts or uses a service that Uberflip needs to connect to, and you restrict the IP addresses which can connect to these services, you should ensure that the IP addresses listed above are added to your Allowed IP list. Examples of applicable services include:

  • Private FTP/SFTP servers that Uberflip connects to in order to download PDFs to convert to Flipbooks
  • Private RSS feeds that are connected to Streams in your Uberflip Hub
  • Marketing Automation Platforms (e.g. Marketo, Eloqua, HubSpot, etc.) or Custom Form CTAs that Uberflip connects to for progressive profiling of visitors and for capturing Form CTA submissions and activity data

articles.name: Customize the content on your Hub's homepage
articles.title: Customize the content on your Hub's homepage
articles.body:
Learn how to customize your Hub's homepage to control the content that's displayed there.

Important

This article outlines how to change your Hub's content Items only. Changing the Stream your content is populating from won't change the title or description of your Hub. To learn about changing the Hub's UI copy and appearance, check out: Get started with branding and customization options on your Hub

Before You Begin

  • To customize a Hub's homepage, you need to be an Account Admin or Content Manager.

Hub homepage content options

There are two options for content you can display on your Hub's homepage:

  1. You Hub's latest content (default) 
  2. A chosen Marketing Stream

We'll outline both options below. 

Use your latest content as your Hub homepage

By default, your Hub homepage displays the 'Latest Content' Stream, a feed of all the most recently published Items across your Hub.

How the 'Latest Content' Stream works:

  • Latest content is shown based on the publishing date of the Item, the most recently published Items being shown first. 
  • If the Item is part of a Marketing Stream, the Item will link to the Marketing Stream it was most recently added to.
  • If the Item isn't part of a Marketing Stream, the Item will link to the Source Stream.
  • Marketing Streams that are hidden, or have the No Robots Meta Tag enabled, will be omitted from the ‘Latest Content’ Stream. In this case, the Item will link to the next Marketing Stream it was most recently added to, or the Source Stream if no such Marketing Streams exists.
  • If the Item isn't part of a (non-hidden) Marketing Stream, and the Source Stream is also hidden, the Item won't appear in the Latest Content Stream.

If you're currently using a Marketing Stream to populate your homepage, but want to use the 'Latest Content' Stream, follow these steps: 

  1. Log in to Uberflip and navigate to the Hub whose homepage you want to customize.
  2. In the sidebar menu on the left, click Hub Options > Advanced
  3. Under Content Experience, find the Replace Home Page with a Marketing Stream option.
  4. Click the dropdown and choose Latest Content.

Choose a Marketing Stream as your Hub homepage

If you prefer to have direct control over the content of your Hub homepage, you can replace the Latest Content Stream with any Marketing Stream of your choice. Since you can choose exactly which Items appear in a Marketing Stream, doing this allows you to control which Items are shown on your Hub's homepage.

  1. Log in to Uberflip and navigate to the Hub whose homepage you want to customize.
  2. In the sidebar menu on the left, click Hub Options > Advanced
  3. Under Content Experience, find the Replace Home Page with a Marketing Stream option. Use the dropdown next to this option to choose the Marketing Stream you want to use instead of the Latest Content Stream:
    • You can choose any of the existing Marketing Streams in your Hub, including any that are hidden.
  4. When you make your selection using the dropdown, the Link Content to Original Source Stream option will appear:
    • When this setting is turned on, clicking on any Item on the homepage (i.e. in the selected Marketing Stream) will take visitors to the clicked Item in its original Source Stream, rather than the selected Marketing Stream.
    • When this setting is turned off, clicking on any Item on the homepage will take visitors to the clicked Item in the selected Marketing Stream.

That's it! Your change will take effect immediately, and content from the selected Marketing Stream will appear on your Hub's homepage.

Note:

  • Any CTAs that you've placed within or beside the Latest Content Stream will not be transferred to a newly selected Marketing Stream. If you'd like CTAs to appear on the Hub homepage, you would have to create new placements for them on the selected Marketing Stream.

articles.name: Use and manage Item tags (and Tag Groups)
articles.title: Use and manage Item tags (and Tag Groups)
articles.body:
Item tags help you categorize and organize your Items by keywords. Tag groups allow you to organize tags, and the content they're applied to, even further. This article shows you how to add and manage Item tags and tag groups in your Hub, which you can use to enhance Hub Search, Smart Filters, and more.

 

Before you begin

  • To work with tags, you need to be an Account Admin, Content Manager, or Author
  • If you're looking to step-up your tagging with advanced options and quick-tagging features, check out the Enhanced Tag Manager app by Uberflip

 

About Item tags and tag groups

In Uberflip, you can add tags to all Items in your Hub, similar to how tags work on most blogging platforms. A tag is simply a keyword used to categorize content, and Items that have a tag are associated with that keyword.

You can use tags to return associated Items when a visitor searches for the keyword in Hub Search (if enabled), or to select Items using Smart Filters.

Tag Groups are collections of tags with similar intents. They’re fully customizable and can be based on any topic or parameter you want.

The organizational structure of your tags, tag groups, and how they relate to each other, is referred to as your tag structure.

A few things you should know about tags and tag groups:

  • Tags can be added to Items only—they can't be added to Streams.
  • By default, tags are not visible on the frontend (i.e. to visitors to your Hub). If you want to show tags (or Item labels based on tags) in your Hub/Streams, custom options are available. Speak with your account manager. 
  • Tags and tag groups are account-wide—if you have multiple Hubs, tags and tag groups you create can be used across all of them. Any tags created in any Hub will be shown in the list of existing tags in the Tags Manager.

For a more in-depth look at tags, tag groups, and tag structures, check out Tags explained.

 

Add or remove tags from Items

In both the Manage Stream page and the Item Editor, you can manually add existing or a new tags to any Item, and remove tags that shouldn't be there.

Add or remove tags in the Manage Stream page

  1. In the Hub you're working with, click Content in the sidebar menu
  2. Now in the Streams tab, find and click the Stream you want to view
  3. In the Stream view, scroll down to the Item Tile for the Item you want to add a tag to. At the bottom of each Item the Tag icon
  4. If an Item already has tags applied to it, the icon will include the number of tags on that Item
  5. Click the Tag icon to open the Tag Item modal:
    • To add an existing tag: Start typing the tag you want to add into the Tags field. Any existing tags and tag groups that match what you've typed will be autosuggested.

      Click an existing tag in the autosuggested list to add it. Added tags will be listed in the Tags box.
    • To create and add a new tag: Type out the full tag text and hit the Enter key. The tag will be added and applied.
    • To remove an existing tag: Click on the x on the tag in the Tags field.
  6. Click Done to save your changes

 

Add or remove tags in the Item Editor

  1. In the Hub you're working with, click Content in the sidebar menu
  2. Select the Items tab
  3. In the list of Items, find and click the Item you want to edit tags for 
  4. The Edit Article view will open. Here, click on the Tags tab
  5. In the Tags field:
    • To add an existing tag: Start typing the tag you want to add. Any existing tags and tag groups that match what you've typed will be autosuggested:

      Click on an autosuggested tag from the list to add it. Tags that have been added will appear in the Tags field.
    • To create and add a new tag: Type out the full tag text and hit the Enter key. The tag will be added and applied.
    • To remove an existing tag: Click on the x on the tag in the Tags field.
  6. Any changes you make here will be saved automatically, and applied immediately.

Tip

You can also edit tags from the Content > Items tab page. Just hover over the Item in the Item list, and click the Tags icon that appears. The same Tag Item menu will appear as when you edit tags in the Manage Stream page.

 

Manage, edit, and delete tags

You can manage your existing tag in the Tags tab of the Tags Managers. Here you can:

  • View a list of all currently existing tags
  • See the number of Items where that tags applied 
  • Add a new tag without assigning it to an Item
  • Edit the tag text for any existing tag
  • Delete a tag 

 

Open the tags manager: Tags tab

  1. In the Hub you're working with, click on Tags in the sidebar menu
  2. Select the Tags tab

Here you'll see a list of all existing tags, the tag groups they're in, the number of Items each tag is applied to, and the date they were was last used.

 

Create a new tag

You can create a new tag without assigning it to any Item using the Tags Manager.

  1. In the Tags tab of the Tags Manager, click Add Tag 
  2. The Add Tag modal will open. Enter the tag text into the Tag Name field. If you want, you can also enter a description of the tag (optional).
  3. Click Save, and your new tag will appear in the tags list

 

Edit an existing tag

You can edit the tag text or description of any existing tag. Doing this will also automatically update the tag text on any Item that the tag is already applied to.

  1. In the Tags Manager, select the Tags tab
  2. Find the tag that you want to edit and hover over it
  3. Click on the Edit button (pencil icon)
  4. The Edit Tag modal will open, showing the current tag text and description. Make any changes you want using the text fields provided.
  5. Click Save 

 

Delete a tag

If you want to delete a tag that's no longer needed, you can do that from the Tags Manager as well.

Caution

Deleting a tag will also immediately remove it from all Items that it is currently applied to, and from all Smart Filters and Scheduled Tasks that reference it (potentially breaking affected filters/tasks). Deleting a tag is permanent and not reversible.

  1. In the Tags Manager, find the tag that you want to delete and hover over it.
  2. Click on the Delete button that appears:
  3. A warning prompt will appear. Review it.
  4. If you're sure you want to delete the tag, click Delete Tag
  5. You'll be returned to the main Tags Manager table, where the deleted tag will no longer appear.

 

Create and manage tag groups

You can create and manage tag groups in the Tag Groups tab of the Tag Manager. Here you can:

  • View a list of all currently existing tag groups 
  • Create new tag groups
  • See and manage which tags are in a tag group
  • Edit a tag group name

 

Open the tags manager: Tags Group tab

  1. In the Hub you're working with, click on Tags in the sidebar menu
  2. Select the Tags Groups tab

Here, you'll see a list of all tag groups in your account, the number of tags in that group, and the date it was last used.

 

Create a new tag group

  1. In the Tag Groups tab of the Tags Manager, click Add Tag Group
  2. The New Tag Group modal will open. Enter the Tag Group name in Tag Group Name field
  3. Click Add Tags in Group
  4. Still in the modal, find and click tags to add them to your new tag group. You can also add a new tag, and remove tags if you change your mind (hover the tag and click the x).
  5. Click Done to save your new tag group

 

See and manage which tags are in a tag group

  1. In the tag groups table, click the number under the Tags Within column beside your tag group
  2. The tag group editor modal will open
  3. Here you can manage the tags within that tag group
    • Add existing tags: find and click a tag in the Ungrouped Tags area to add it to the tag group
    • Add a new tag: Click New Tag in the Ungrouped Tags area to add a new tag.
    • Remove tags: Hover a tag in the Tags Within Group area and click the x that appear to remove the tag from this group (the tag with become ungrouped).
  4. Click Done to save your changes

 

Edit a tag group name

In the tag groups table, hover over the tag group and click the edit button (pencil icon) beside the current name. This will open the name field for editing. Edit the tag group name, then click the checkmark to save the change.

 

Notes

  • If you need to tag many Items at once, you can use Smart Filters to do this. Check out Use Smart Filters to automate content workflows for more details
  • If you're looking to step-up your tagging with advanced options and quick-tagging methods, check out the Enhanced Tag Manager app by Uberflip

articles.name: Replace an Entire Flipbook
articles.title: Replace an Entire Flipbook
articles.body:
If you need to make major changes to an existing Flipbook and the Page Replacement tool can't do the job, you can use the Replace Flipbook tool instead. Here's how.

 

Before You Begin

  • To use the Page Replacement tool, you need to be a member of the Account Admin, Content Manager or Developer/Designer user groups.

 

About the Replace Flipbook Tool

If you've uploaded a PDF to create a Flipbook, but discovered post-upload that there's an typo or some other kind of error, you can often use the Page Replacement tool to swap out the problem pages. But the Page Replacement tool has some limitations: it can replace pages one-for-one, but it can't add or remove any pages. If your Flipbook is missing pages or has extra pages that you need to remove, you can use the Replace Flipbook tool instead.

Using this tool will cost one upload credit, just like creating a brand-new Flipbook. However, the benefit of using the Replace Flipbook tool over simply deleting the Flipbook and uploading a new copy is that using it preserves the Flipbook's URL — so if you've already promoted that URL, fixing the underlying Flipbook won't break the shared links.

Flipbook Credit Exception

Replacing a Flipbook in your account will not cost an upload credit if you are on an Exclusive, Elite or Enterprise pack type.

Before using the Replace Flipbook tool, be sure to review the following to understand what will be preserved, and what will be deleted, as a result of using the tool to replace a Flipbook.

Elements deleted from a Flipbook when using the Replace Flipbook tool (if present):

  • Bookmarks and notes made with the Annotation Tool
  • Any changes made to page text and table of contents
  • Clippings
  • Links
  • Advertiser index
  • Tabs
  • Audio/video placements
    • The videos themselves will be preserved; only the placements are deleted
  • Page Widgets

 Elements preserved in a Flipbook when using the Replace Flipbook tool (if present):

  • All Uberflip Analytics data associated with the Flipbook
  • Any Items in your Hub that refer to the Flipbook
  • Auto-Link jobs that were previously run on the Flipbook
  • Features Flipbook settings in any Library Apps
  • Legacy Metrics email sets
  • Geo campaigns

 

Replace a Flipbook

You can open the Replace Flipbook tool on any existing Flipbook.

  1. Log in to Uberflip and click on Flipbooks.
  2. Use the dropdown menu on the left under Select a Folder to Manage to choose the Folder which contains the Flipbook you want to work on.
  3. Inside the Folder view, click on the Flipbook to open its Flipbook Settings & Options screen.
  4. Under the Flipbook Options section near the bottom, find the Replace Flipbook button (under the Manage column) and click on it to open the tool:
  5. A warning pop-up will appear, asking if you're sure you want to replace the Flipbook. Make sure you understand the consequences of proceeding, then click on the Replace Flipbook button.
  6. You'll be taken to the standard PDF upload menu (the same as when you upload a PDF to create a new Flipbook). Simply choose the PDF you want to use to replace the existing Flipbook and configure any options as necessary. For help with this, see this article.
  7. Once the upload and conversion completes, the new PDF will replace your existing Flipbook, preserving its URL/links.

articles.name: Internal: Redirect Hub Homepage Only
articles.title: Internal: Redirect Hub Homepage Only
articles.body:
Objective

Customer wants to have the base domain of Hub redirect somewhere, but all other pages served within Hub. This requires a redirect rule that applies to only the Hub Home.

 

Create Redirect Rule

  1. Create a new Redirect Rule
  2. Set Source Path as Any, Matches Regular Expression
  3. For matching argument, enter: /$

  4. Set destination to any location you want and save the rule.

articles.name: Replace a Page in a Flipbook
articles.title: Replace a Page in a Flipbook
articles.body:
If you spot a mistake or other problem with your Flipbook after uploading, you don't need to reupload the whole Flipbook - just replace the affected page(s) with the Page Replacement tool. Here's how.

 

Before You Begin

  • To use the Page Replacement tool, you need to be a member of the Account Admin, Content Manager or Developer/Designer user groups.
  • This tool allows you to replace any page in a Flipbook, but inserting or removing pages is not possible.
  • You'll need a one-page PDF file that consists only of the (corrected) page that you want to replace in the existing Flipbook.

Usage Policy

The Page Replacement tool is intended to be used to correct pages in an existing Flipbook, as uploading a new Flipbook will change the URL (which may already be shared) and costs an upload credit. 

However, this tool must not be used to replace all pages in an existing Flipbook. In this case, a new Flipbook should be uploaded instead. Uberflip reserves the right to disable this tool on accounts where it is being used outside its intended purpose.

 

Open the Page Replacement Tool

You can open the Page Replacement tool on any existing Flipbook.

  1. Log in to Uberflip and click on Flipbooks.
  2. Use the dropdown menu on the left under Select a Folder to Manage to choose the Folder which contains the Flipbook you want to work on.
  3. Inside the Folder view, click on the Flipbook to open its Flipbook Settings & Options screen.
  4. Under the Flipbook Options section near the bottom, find the Replace a Page button (under the Enhance column) and click on it to open the tool:
  5. The Page Replacement tool will open, and you can now choose and configure the page to be replaced.

 

Replace a Page with the Page Replacement Tool

Once the Page Replacement tool is open, you can choose the page to be replaced, the page you'll replace it with, and configure some additional options.

  1. With the Page Replacement Tool open, begin by making sure that the correct Flipbook is shown under the Select Flipbook section.
  2. Under the Replace a Page Within a Selected Flipbook section, begin by using the dropdown under Select Page to choose the page in the existing Flipbook that you want to replace:
    • If you have set a page offset on the Flipbook, you'll see the page numbers in the format absolute page number [relative page number]: for example, a page offset of +2 would show options like 1 [3] or 20 [22].
  3. Once you make a selection, a preview thumbnail of the page will appear under Page Preview (click to zoom). Use this to confirm you have the right page:
  4. Under Replacement Info, you'll see a counter showing how many pages have previously been replaced in this Flipbook (if any). This counter increments by one each time you use the tool on the same Flipbook.
  5. Under Upload PDF, click on Choose File to select the one-page PDF containing the replacement page.
    • Only the first page in the uploaded PDF will be used, so make sure that the PDF file consists of just one page (or that the page to be used is the first page for multi-page PDF files).
  6. Configure any options as desired:
    • Replace page's links: If checked, will delete any existing links on the page being replaced, and the Auto-Link Tool will be re-run on only this page to recreate any embedded and custom links (if previously configured). When enabled, requires the Update stored PDF option to also be checked as well.
    • Replace page's text: If checked, automatically extracted text from the page being replaced will be deleted, and replaced with text extracted from the new page. When enabled, requires the Update stored PDF option to also be checked as well.
    • Update stored PDF: If checked, updates the stored PDF version of the Flipbook as well, which is the PDF copy of the Flipbook that can be downloaded by users. Must be enabled if any of the other two options are checked.
  7. When you're ready to proceed, click on the Upload & Replace button to begin the replacement process.
    • During replacement, the Flipbook will show the status "Replacing Page", and will be temporarily inaccessible for users. This should be completed within a few seconds.
  8. Once the replacement process is complete, the Flipbook will display the new page in place of the old one when viewed.

articles.name: Internal: What is Vidyard's internal structure and how does the UF integration hook into Vidyard?
articles.title: Internal: What is Vidyard's internal structure and how does the UF integration hook into Vidyard?
articles.body:
Question

What is Vidyard's internal structure of video organization and how/what does Uberflip Import?

 

Answer

Vidyard hierarchy is as follows:

Account>Parent Group>Sub-Groups>Players>Videos

 

Groups

Vidyard spiel:

A parent group is the overarching group within your organization. The parent group has the ability to view and manage all sub-group assets.

Sub-groups are individual accounts that live within the parent group of your organization's Vidyard account. Sub-groups allow for the configuration of separate videos, players, users, integrations and analytics. Sub-groups can be created to divide content between different teams and divisions, or for specific projects.

The ability to create and manage different sub-groups allows your Vidyard account to be highly scalable as your organization's goals, priorities and business needs change.

There is no limit to the number of sub-groups that can be created.

 

Uberflip Context:

  • Each group/subgroup has its own API token set
  • A Stream is created by using a group's API Token, and all Players and the videos associated with those players will be imported.  There must be at least one player and video in a group to create a stream otherwise an error will occur when importing
  • NOTE: There could be volume issues where we timeout after 2 minutes, but we should be able to import upwards of 6000 videos within that 2 minutes

 

Players

  • Vidyard Player is the 'skin' that is used when viewing a video associated with that player.  Various control options (IE autoplay)
  • Within a Vidyard Group, in order to serve a video, and in order to import that Group into a Hub, you need at least one Player
  • A Group can have Multiple players, and a Player can have multiple videos associated

Videos

  • A video is the media file that is uploaded into Vidyard Groups and added to Vidyard Player
  • At least one video needs to be within the group and added to a Player in order to import into a Stream

NOTE: There is no way known to import all videos, in all players, in all groups into a single stream

articles.name: Internal: Pull query string values and push to hidden CTA fields
articles.title: Internal: Pull query string values and push to hidden CTA fields
articles.body:
<script>

// Set cookie with query string values -- UF
// This function is dependent on the jQuery cookie plugin included in hubs_lib.js
function setUtmCookies() {

//set vars for each query string variable to be captured from URL
 var UFutmSource = getQueryStringVariable('utm_source');
 var UFutmMedium = getQueryStringVariable('utm_medium');
 
//If query string parameter exists, set cookie with that value and define expiry in days
//To set a session cookie only, use format  $.cookie('cookiename', queryStringVariable);
if (UFutmSource) {
 $.cookie('UFutmSourceCookie', UFutmSource, {
 expires: 30
 });
 }
 
 if (UFutmMedium) {
 $.cookie('UFutmMediumCookie', UFutmMedium, {
 expires: 30
 });
 } 
}



// Push cookie values into hidden fields -- UF
function cookieToCta() {
 if ($.cookie('UFutmSourceCookie')) {
 //find the hidden input and set the value to the cookie value.
 $('.preview-form-field[data-mapping="utm_source"]').val($.cookie('UFutmSourceCookie'));
 }
 
 if ($.cookie('UFutmMediumCookie')) {
 //find the hidden input and set the value to the cookie value.
 $('.preview-form-field[data-mapping="utm_medium"]').val($.cookie('UFutmMediumCookie'));
 }
}


// get query string variable values -- UF
function getQueryStringVariable(variable) {
 var query = window.location.search.substring(1);
 var vars = query.split("&");
 for (var i = 0; i < vars.length; i++) {
 var pair = vars[i].split("=");
 if (pair[0] == variable) {
 return pair[1];
 }
 }
 return (false);
}

// Delete query string cookies upon form submission -- UF
function deleteUtmCookies() {
 if ($.cookie('UFutmSourceCookie')) {
 
 
 
 $.cookie('UFutmSourceCookie', null, {
 expires: -1
 });
 }
 
 if ($.cookie('UFutmMediumCookie')) {
 
 $.cookie('UFutmMediumCookie', null, {
 expires: -1
 });
 }
}

//on load set cookies
//on activation of CTA get cookie values
//on form submit delete cookies
//UF
Hubs.Events.on('load', function(){
 setUtmCookies();
 }) 
.on('ctaActivate', function(){
 cookieToCta();
 })
.on('ctaFormSubmitSuccess' , function(){
 deleteUtmCookies();
 }); 
</script>

articles.name: Integration with Reachforce Smart Forms
articles.title: Integration with Reachforce Smart Forms
articles.body:
1.  Smartforms.js script, which is provided by Reach Force and looks something like below but with a unique data-token value per customer, needs to be present either via a Custom Code block>Body Bottom or via Google Tag Manager

 

<script type="text/javascript" src="//cdn.reachforce.com/SmartForms.js" data-token="999999"></script>

 

2. This smartforms.js script requires a `name` attribute on each form field.  So we have this script which can run on ctaActivate, and that will add the name attribute to each form field, reflecting each field's `data-mapping` value

 


Hubs.Events.on('ctaActivate', function smartformsNameAddition(){
 $('[data-mapping]').each(function() {
 $(this).attr('name',$(this).attr('data-mapping'));
 console.log(this);
});
 });

articles.name: Internal: Extract a list of Standalone Flipbook URLs
articles.title: Internal: Extract a list of Standalone Flipbook URLs
articles.body:
Objective

Customers may ask for a list of all Flipbook IDs or URLs in their UF account for whatever reason.  One big reason is they are looking to CHURN, so be aware of that and follow up with CSM before you provide the 'export'

 

Use the Admin>Flipbooks Page to get a list of all Customer Flipbooks

  1. As an UF Admin, go to 'Flipbooks' Page
  2. Search for Company Name to arrive at a list of Flipbooks
  3. Set the view to the max of 100
  4. Copy the table and paste into a spreadsheet
  5. If more than one page you'll need to view each subsequent page, and copy and paste into the same spreadsheet
  6. This will give a list of all Flipbooks and their IDs, Folder name, Flipbook name, Pub and Created Dates, Owner and status.
  7. To get the list of the URLs, you'll need to use the  spreadsheets 'Concatenate' function to stitch:  "https://sub.company.com/i/" and the Flipbook ID together

 

Additional Notes

  • If Customer is a Master account you would need to search for each sub-account name in the Flipbooks page and do the steps above for each sub-account
  • The Flipbook URLs provided via method above don't include the Flipbook Name URL slug on the extract.  More effort would be required to display that in the extract, in that you would need to concatenate the Flipbook Name on the end of the URL and swap special characters for hyphens. But because the non slug URLs ultimately end up on the slug appended URL, that may not be an issue depending on the customer requirements

articles.name: Customize Hub page UI text or language with Custom Labels
articles.title: Customize Hub page UI text or language with Custom Labels
articles.body:
Hubs have numerous predefined labels, such as "Latest Content", "Continue Reading", etc. With the Custom Labels tool, you can easily change these to anything you want, and even specify translations for non-English Hubs.

 

Before you begin

  • Access to this feature is controlled by the Hub > Custom Labels permissions (View and Edit).
  • By default, the permissions necessary to use this feature are granted to all users in the Account Administrators, Content Managers, and Developers/Designers user groups.

 

About Custom Labels

Your Hub comes with standard labels for all of the various interface elements that users see and can interact with: titles, headings, buttons — basically, anywhere that text appears in your Hub's interface. Of course, one size doesn't fit all, so you can customize nearly all of these labels to make them consistent with your brand, and the language your company uses.

To do that, you use the Custom Labels tool. This tool allows you to view all the labels across your Hub and modify them to whatever you want. And, if needed, you can also customize labels specifically at the Stream and Item levels, so that you can set custom labels for specific Streams and Items.

Custom Labels also works with the Hub Locale setting to translate your Hub into other languages. Translations of the default labels are available for a number of languages, and you can customize any of the translated labels to fit your needs. Plus, for languages where no ready-made translation is available yet, you can use Custom Labels to create your own custom translation.

Warning

If you have previously enabled custom labels or translations on a Hub through OnBrand customizations, you must disable these customizations before enabling Custom Labels. If you don't do this, the OnBrand customizations will override the functionality of the Custom Labels tool, which can lead to unexpected behavior in your Hub.

 

Customize labels

At the Hub Level

The main Custom Labels tool allows you to set custom labels that apply across your entire Hub: anywhere that a given label appears, any custom label you set will be displayed.

  1. Log in to Uberflip and navigate to the Hub you want to work with.
  2. In the sidebar menu on the left, click on Appearance > Custom Labels.
  3. You should now see a list of all the labels in your Hub. For instructions on how to modify these labels, see below.

 

At the Stream Level

You can also customize labels at the Stream level, which means that the custom labels you set will appear only on the specified Stream. Custom labels set at the Stream level will override any Hub-level customizations for the same label for that Stream.

  1. In Uberflip, click on Content in the sidebar menu on the left.
  2. On the right, click on the Stream for which you want to set custom labels (under the Streams tab).
  3. On the next page, click on the Custom Labels tab near the top:
  4. You should now see a list of all the labels that can be modified for this Stream. For instructions on how to modify these labels, see below.

 

At the Item Level

You can also customize labels at the Item level, which means that the custom labels you set are applicable only to that specific Item. Custom labels set at the Item level will override any Stream-level and Hub-level customizations for the same label for that particular Item.

  1. In Uberflip, click on Content in the sidebar menu on the left.
  2. On the right, click on the Items tab, then click on the Item for which you want to set a custom label.
  3. On the next page, click on the Custom Labels tab near the top:
  4. You should now see a list of all the labels that can be modified for this Item. For instructions on how to modify these labels, see below.

 

Set a Custom Label

The method for setting a custom label is the same regardless of whether you're doing so at the Hub, Stream, or Item level.

Info

The list of labels will be filtered automatically depending on where you are viewing it (i.e. at the Hub, Stream, or Item level) to only show labels that are relevant to that level.

  1. Once you're on the Custom Labels tab, you will see a list of all available labels by default. You can use the Search box near the top to filter this list using keywords:
  2. You can also use the dropdown to the right to filter the list based on the interface categories that the labels belong to:
  3. The table of labels consists of three columns. Each line shows the default label (essentially the "label name") under the Standard Label column, the category it belongs to under the Category column, and a text box under the Custom Label column:
  4. By default, the same label text will appear in both the Standard Label and Custom Label boxes. To use a custom label instead of the default for a given label, type the text you want to use into the text box under the Custom Label column:
  5. To undo a custom label, simply remove the text from the text box. When no custom label is in use, the default label will appear in the text box in grey text.
  6. Whenever you make any change, it will be saved automatically, and will take effect immediately.

Info: Text Variables

Some of the labels contain text variables. You can identify them by the use of curly brackets around the variable, like this:

These variables are automatically filled in with information from your Hub. There are three variables:

Variable Definition Set under

{{collectiontitle}}

 The title of the relevant Stream Content > Streams > Stream Name

{{company}}

 The name of your company  Appearance > Branding > Company Name

{{author-full-name}}

 The name of the Item's author Account Settings > Organization > Users > User Profile > First Name/Last Name

You can insert these variables into any custom label (including labels that do not include a variable by default).

 

Translate labels with Hub Locale

The Hub Locale setting for your Hub defines the Hub's language and region for search engines and browsers, and determines the language of all the label text that appears across the Hub.

The default setting of English (United States) sets all label text to English (with US-style spelling where applicable). You can translate this label text to another language by changing the Hub Locale:

  • If you change the Hub Locale to a language where a default translation is available (see below), all labels will be translated automatically (but you can still customize them with Custom Labels if you want).
  • If you change the Hub Locale to a language without a preset translation, you can use Custom Labels to provide your own translations.

To learn more about Hub Locale and how to set it, see this article.

Default translation available

Ready-made translations of the default Hub labels are available for the most popular Hub languages. These are:

  • Chinese (Simplified)
  • French (Canadian)
  • German
  • Italian
  • Spanish

If you set your Hub Locale to any of these languages, all of the labels will be translated into that language automatically. For example, here is a set of default labels in English (United States):

And the same labels when the Hub Locale has been set to Spanish (Spain):

As with the English-language labels, you can also customize the default translations in any way you want.

No default translation available

If you set your Hub Locale to any language for which a default translation is not available, the standard labels will be the same as for English (United States). For these languages, you can use the Custom Labels tool to translate them manually: simply type the translation into the appropriate Custom Label text box for each label.

Once you have created custom translations for a given Hub Locale language, the translated labels will be saved to that Hub Locale setting, and can be applied to other Hubs by setting them to that Hub Locale.

articles.name: Duplicate Items showing in Stream on Hub
articles.title: Duplicate Items showing in Stream on Hub
articles.body:
Issue

Item tiles repeated on the frontend (Stream homepage), but not in the backend (list of Streams).

  • Items displaying more than once in a Stream
  • Duplicate Items in Stream

 

Conditions

  • Where: Duplicate tiles seen on the live stream page, but not in the backend of the hub
  • Who: Anyone viewing a Stream homepage
  • When: Anytime when viewing a Stream homepage
  • Any browser seems affected by this issue
  • Any operating system seems affected by this issue

 

Steps to Fix (Workaround)

  1. View the Stream's main page (in the frontend) in your browser
  2. Locate the first repeating/duplicate tile in the Stream
  3. In a separate tab, view the Stream in the Hub backend
  4. Click-and-drag the first duplicate tile (from step 2) to reposition it left or right by 1 tile
  5. Click-and-drag the same tile back to its original position
  6. Reload the Stream's homepage in the frontend
  7. The repeating tile(s) issue should now be corrected

 

Additional Notes

Due to the rare nature of this issue, Uberflip's Development team is actively working to isolate the root cause of this issue to deploy a permanent fix.

articles.name: Internal: "This domain cannot be saved" Error
articles.title: Internal: "This domain cannot be saved" Error
articles.body:
Issue

I'm not able to add a new domain for a customer. When I try to create a domain, I get the message "this domain cannot be saved".

  • Can't add domain for customer
  • Can't create new domain
  • Domain can't be saved 

 

 

Conditions

  • Where: Admin backend, Manage Domains section
  • Who: Any Uberflip employee with access to the admin backend
  • When: After clicking on +Add a new domain, entering the domain name, then clicking on Add
  • The domain to be added is a placeholder or otherwise temporary
  • The selected domain is in the format something.uberflip.com
  • The selected domain is already in use
  • Affects all browsers and operating systems

 

Cause

It's not possible to create subdomains of the domain uberflip.com (e.g. anything.uberflip.com), as these are restricted. Alternatively, the domain may already be in use.

 

Steps to Fix

Instead of using using the domain uberflip.com, or the domain you chose, use any other domain. If you need a placeholder domain that is functional, use ufcontent.com (e.g. customername.ufcontent.com).

articles.name: What does "crawlable" and "no-index/follow" mean?
articles.title: What does "crawlable" and "no-index/follow" mean?
articles.body:
Question

When I view the list of Streams in my Hub, I see either "crawlable" or "no-index/follow" next to each Stream under the SEO column. What does this mean?

 

Answer

The SEO column in the list of Streams (under Content > Streams) shows the current status of each Stream's "robots meta directive". The robots meta directive allows you to influence the behavior of search engine robots, which are the automated systems that analyze ("crawl") websites for inclusion in a search engine's results ("indexing").

You'll see one of three statuses under the SEO column for each Stream:

  • no-index/follow: There is a robots meta directive set on the Stream, and it is configured to tell search engines not to include (index) the Stream or any Items within it in their search results. The follow part of the tag tells search engines that they can still follow links in the Stream to discover other pages (which might be in a crawlable Stream).
    • Corresponding Stream Option: No Robots Meta Tag is set to off.
  • crawlable: There is no robots meta directive set on the Stream. Search engines are able to crawl and index the Stream, and its content will appear in search results for relevant search terms.
    • Corresponding Stream Option: No Robots Meta Tag is set to on.
  • crawlable (canonical): The same as crawlable, but "canonical tags" are also added to all Item pages that belong to the Stream. The canonical tag tells search engines that a page is a duplicate of an original page (and where to find the original) to avoid duplicate content issues. For more details about canonical tags, see this article.
    • Corresponding Stream Options: No Robots Meta Tag is set to on, Enable Canonical Meta Tag is set to on.

You can adjust the setting of a Stream’s robots meta directive by using the No Robots Meta Tag Stream Option. To learn how, see this article:

Block Google (and Other Search Engines) From Searching your Hub Content

articles.name: Hub Hack: Hide Calendly Flipbot Tile in Specific Sales Streams
articles.title: Hub Hack: Hide Calendly Flipbot Tile in Specific Sales Streams
articles.body:
Use this Custom Code snippet if you want to prevent the Calendly Flipbot Tile from appearing in specific Sales Streams.

Warning

Hub Hacks are not official Uberflip features.

Hub Hacks may not work on all Hubs, or may cause unexpected behavior. If you experience issues with a Hub Hack, available support is limited to helping you disable the Hub Hack only.

Important

Hub Hacks are not compatible with Front End V2 Hubs.

If you are not sure if your Hub uses Front End V2, see this article for help.

Details

  • Type: CSS
  • Placement: Head
  • Notes: You'll need the Stream ID of the Sales Stream that you want to apply this to. You can find it by opening the Sales Stream in your browser and looking at the URL:

 

Code

<style>
/* To add a Sales Stream paste in the Stream ID over 'IdNumberHere' */
.stream-IdNumberHere .flipbot-calendly-cta { 
display: none;
}
</style>

articles.name: Internal: Anchor links scroll to wrong part of page
articles.title: Internal: Anchor links scroll to wrong part of page
articles.body:
Issue

Some client's injected headers are not accounted for when anchor links are used (to scroll to a certain part of a page).

  • Anchor links will scroll vertically passed the point where it is set by the amount of vertical pixels of the injected header

 

Conditions

  • Where: All places where anchor links are used (on affected hubs)
  • Who: All users (on affected hubs)
  • When: Anchor link is added to item
  • All browsers are affected
  • All operating systems are affected 

 

Cause

Anchor links do not account for the injected headers in some Hubs, causing the anchor to navigate further down the page than expected.

 

Steps to Fix

Use Custom Code to adjust for the height of the injected header.

  1. Create a new custom code block in the affected Hub.
  2. Select the placement as Body Bottom.
  3. Paste in the following code, making sure to replace the 100 placeholder with the height of the injected header in pixels. When you are finished, enable the code block.
<script>
// The function actually applying the offset
function offsetAnchor() {
 if (location.hash.length !== 0) {
 window.scrollTo(window.scrollX, window.scrollY - 100);
 }
}

// Captures click events of all <a> elements with href starting with #
$(document).on('click', 'a[href^="#"]', function(event) {
 // Click events are captured before hash changes. Timeout
 // causes offsetAnchor to be called after the page jump.
 window.setTimeout(function() {
 offsetAnchor();
 }, 0);
});

// Set the offset when entering page with hash present in the url
window.setTimeout(offsetAnchor, 0);
</script>

articles.name: Internal: Flipbook Not Loading in Hub Page
articles.title: Internal: Flipbook Not Loading in Hub Page
articles.body:
Issue

On occasion, a scenario may occur when a Flipbook Item won't load properly in a Hub page and the result is an error message displaying in the iframe where the Flipbook should display.  Will look something like this depending on the browser

  • Generic Browser Error is shown within the iframe where the Flipbook should load up

 

Conditions

  • This problem is going to occur when a Custom Domain is used on the Hub
  • Where: Front end Hub Flipbook Item view is affected in that the Flipbook will not load
  • Who: End users are impacted with this behaviour because they cannot access certain Flipbooks within the Hub
  • When:  This happens when there is some sort of mismatch between the Hub domain and the default domain set for the Flipbook.  Most often this is going to happen when SSL/HTTPS is enabled on the Hub Domain that is having the Flipbook not display, but the Flipbook Folder's default domain is not HTTPS

 

Cause

If the Default Domain for a Flipbook's parent folder does not match the Hub's domain's protocol (IE the Flipbook default domain is http and the Hub domain is HTTPS) a mixed content issue arises and modern browsers choose to not display the iframe content.

 

Steps to Fix

  1. Find the Source Flipbook's ID by checking source code of Hub Item and finding the iframe src URL. Will look something like this:
    <iframe src="https://resources.altium.com/i/845809?source=hub&expanded=false&hubItemID=351484687&m4" frameborder="0" width="100%" height="570" webkitAllowFullScreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>
  2. Manage that Flipbook's Folder by searching for the Flipbook ID you found in the iframe source per #1 above, in the Admin>Flipbooks section
  3. Edit the Flipbook's parent Folder>Options>Default Domain
  4. Pick a default domain that already has HTTPS enabled.  If you have multiple options because there might be multiple Hubs, best to choose the domain that best applies to the Flipbook content, just ensure that domain is SSL enabled
  5. Force an update so the Hub Item reflects the new Default Domain for the Flipbook by managing the Flipbook Stream>Hamburger Menu>Update

 

Additional Notes

If the Flipbook Default Domains are being checked at the time of SSL enablement of a Customer's Hub Domain, the above problem should never occur, but these instructions can be used to fix the problem once it's been identified.

articles.name: Internal: Enable HSTS (HTTP Strict Transport Security) on Customer Domains
articles.title: Internal: Enable HSTS (HTTP Strict Transport Security) on Customer Domains
articles.body:
Objective

Many security scanners will want HSTS enabled as a security best practice so we are likely to hear more and more customers requesting this feature be added to their Domains.

More on HSTS here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_Strict_Transport_Security

We can support HSTS today but we must enable on a domain by domain basis with a JIRA for OPS

 

Steps Required to Have HSTS enabled on Customer Domain(s)

  1. Ask the customer for some information we need to enabled HSTS:

    `max_age`: How long should browsers remember to automatically upgrade HTTP requests to HTTPS for this domain? Our default is 1 year, max is 2 years.
    `include_subdomains`    : Do they want browsers to automatically upgrade requests to subdomains of this domain? In most cases this won't matter because customers won't have subdomains of their hub domains.

    `preload`    : Do they want to eventually submit this domain to Google to include it in the HSTS preload list, so all Chrome users automatically get upgraded, without ever having seen the HSTS header
  2. Gather the above and create an OPS JIRA ticket specifying the domain(s) customer wants HSTS on.

 

Additional Notes

Enabling HSTS is not something that we enable by default on Domains once they get HTTPS enabled, as it could cause the Hub to lose traffic if they ever want to turn https off for some reason (e.g. they switch https on, find broken/mixed-content links, and switch it off again to fix them).  This is why we do on a request by request basis, initiated by customers.

articles.name: Track Google Ads Conversions on Form CTA Submissions
articles.title: Track Google Ads Conversions on Form CTA Submissions
articles.body:
Objective

I've set up an ad campaign in Google Ad Manager, and now I'd like to track the performance of the ad conversions based on Uberflip Form CTA submits.

 

Prerequisite: Set Up a Google Ad Manager Campaign

To get started, you'll need to create your campaign in Google Ad Manager, and set up a conversion tracking. Once that is complete, you'll copy the Conversion ID and Conversion label that will be used later on in Google Tag Manager (GTM).

You can find instructions on how set up conversion tracking in this article from Google:

Google: Set up conversion tracking for your website

Follow the instructions in this article until you reach the end of "Step 1: Create a conversion action". Then, continue on the next steps in this article.

 

Step 1: Configure your Tag in Google Tag Manager (GTM)

  1. Create a new Google Ads Conversion Tracking tag in GTM and name it anything you'd like.
  2. Once created, you'll need to define at a minimum the "Conversion ID" and the "Conversion Label" - these can be found in the campaign you setup for Google Ad Manager for that particular ad.
  3. Save the tag, we'll being adding a trigger later on. As a placeholder, you can have it fire on all pages for now.

 

Step 2: Configure your Trigger in GTM

  1. Create a "Custom Event" type trigger in your GTM container and give it a name.
  2. In the configuration, add in an Event name, for example: "ctaConvertedAssetName" (Note: it's important that this name is unique. The name will also be referenced in a later step in this article, so keep it handy).
  3. Save the trigger and attach it to the Tag you setup in Step 1.

 

Step 3: Configure the Conversion Linker Tag 

Google suggests adding a Conversion Linker tag to fire on all pages. This is to ensure proper tracking in all browsers. You can find the instructions to set that up here.

 

Step 4: Add gtag.js to your Hub

In order for conversion tracking to work, you'll need the global site tag (gtag.js) added to every page of your Hub. To do so, add a code block in your Hub under Appearance > Custom Code. This code block will have the code placed in the <head>.

Once the code block is created, use the global site tag script from Google's developer documentation that can be found here.

Note

If you're already tracking page views through our built-in Google Analytics integration, or if you are tracking page views through your Google Tag Manager setup, please ensure that you add a parameter in your gtag.js setup to exclude pageview hits. You can find detailed instructions on how to do this in the Google documentation linked above.

 

Step 5: Pass Data Layer Variable Using Custom Code in your Hub

In Step 2, we created a trigger in GTM that is looking for a "Custom Event". This next piece of code we'll setup will pass this event name through the data layer and be picked up by your tag and trigger that you setup earlier.

  1. Create a custom code block in your Hub under Appearance > Custom Code
  2. Change the placement of the code block to be inserted in the "Body Bottom"
  3. Add the following code block template seen below:
<script>
 (function($,Hubs, undefined){ Hubs.Events.on('ctaFormSubmitSuccess',function(ctaId, ctaData, ctaName){
 if (ctaId == XXXXXX) {
 googleAdwords(ctaId, ctaData, ctaName);
 }
 }); function googleAdwords(ctaId, ctaData, ctaName){
 console.log(ctaId);
 window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];
 window.dataLayer.push({
 'event' : 'ctaConvertedAssetName'
 });
 }
 }(window.jQuery, window.Hubs));
 </script>

Once that code block is added, you need to swap out two components based on your needs:

  1. Where we see -- ctaId == XXXXXX -- you'll want to replace the X's with the 6 digit CTA ID that is being used to track conversions on
  2. Where we see -- 'ctaConvertedAssetName' -- you'll want to replace that with the name that you gave your "Custom Event" trigger in GTM in Step 2 of this article. (Note: the name must match exactly).
  3. Click "Save" on the code block and ensure that it is enabled

 

Additional Notes

In the above example from Step 5, we are targeting this code to only fire when a certain CTA is submitted. If you'd like, you can setup additional triggers to suit your needs.

For instance, if you'd like the conversion event to fire when a certain CTA is filled out BUT only on certain URLs, you can edit your tag in Step 1 to include a trigger that is looking for a certain URL path or hostname.

articles.name: AddThis Widget Not Appearing
articles.title: AddThis Widget Not Appearing
articles.body:
Issue

After integrating with AddThis using the appropriate "RA" code, the Tool is still not appearing on my Hub.

  • I've setup a Tool in AddThis and integrated my Hub with AddThis, but the Tool isn't appearing
  • My Hub is integrated with AddThis, but I don't see any social share icons appearing
  • In AddThis, I've created a social share Tool, but it is not appearing in my Hub
  • I've created the "Floating" Tool in AddThis and activated it, but it is not showing up on the front-end of my Hub

 

Conditions

  • Where: AddThis Tools that are integrated natively through the Uberflip app
  • Who: Front-end users are impacted where they do not see the social sharing icons
  • When: The admin has added and activated a Tool in AddThis and integrated their account within the Uberflip app
  • Could affect any up to date Browser and Operating System 

 

Steps to Fix

  1. Ensure that you've integrated with the correct AddThis "RA" code in your Uberflip Hub
  2. If you haven't already, ensure a Tool has been created an activated in AddThis
  3. On the Tool setup in AddThis, ensure that certain URLs are not excluded. This is located in the "Advanced Options" of your Tool setup in AddThis
  4. If you've enabled the Tool, integrated AddThis with your Hub, and the social share icons are still not visible, remove the integration in Uberflip and re-add the "RA" code, then click "Save"

 

Additional Notes

The "Floating" Tool created in AddThis will work once the Tool is activated and the "RA" code is integrated in your Uberflip app. However, the "Inline" Tool will not work automatically. It will require an additional <div> tag to be added to the page where you want it to appear.

For example, it would look like this:

<div class="addthis_inline_share_toolbox"></div>

articles.name: Are Hub Items with URL parameters being counted twice in Google Analytics?
articles.title: Are Hub Items with URL parameters being counted twice in Google Analytics?
articles.body:
Question

When I click on a link to an Item in the Hub, I noticed that Uberflip briefly takes me to a page that has parameters at the end of the URL, then redirects to a page without the parameters. Does this mean that Google Analytics is double-counting every Item view?

 

Answer

When you see the URL parameters disappear from the address bar, no redirect is actually taking place. As a result, no additional pageview is sent to Google Analytics (views are only counted once). In addition, the built-in Google Analytics integration will strip the additional URL parameters before sending the data to Google Analytics.

Note

If you are using Google Tag Manager (or another Analytics tool) to trigger the track type of "Pageview", you will still notice page URLs with URL parameters in Google Analytics data when viewing by “Page” (Page URL) dimension. You can consolidate these pages by switching your "Primary Dimension" in Google Analytics to "Page Title". Alternatively, if you choose to connect to the built-in Uberflip Google Analytics integration you will want to remove this type of tracking on your Uberflip Hub via Google Tag Manager.

articles.name: Use Digesto to Automatically Notify Subscribers About Hub Content Updates
articles.title: Use Digesto to Automatically Notify Subscribers About Hub Content Updates
articles.body:
Learn how to use Digesto to let visitors subscribe to your Hub, so that they can be automatically notified by email whenever you publish new content.

 

Before You Begin

  • To do this, you'll need a Digesto account. To sign up for one, visit Digesto's website.
  • Digesto is an app for Marketo, so you need a Marketo account to use it. This also means that, to use Digesto with your Uberflip Hub content, you will need to integrate Marketo with your Uberflip Hub.

 

About Digesto

Digesto is an RSS-to-Email application for Marketo. If you're using Marketo as your Marketing Automation Platform, Digesto lets visitors subscribe to updates to your Hub, then automatically sends them scheduled email summaries of your latest content.

Here's how it works: in your Hub, you set up a Marketo-connected Form CTA that prompts visitors to subscribe to your content updates by entering their email (and any other information you want to collect):

You can place this CTA in a Stream, then set up Digesto to monitor that Stream's RSS feed. On a schedule you specify, Digesto will package new Items that have appeared in the Stream's RSS feed into an email "digest", and send it to any subscriber who submitted the Form CTA.

If you want to use Digesto in your Hub, here's what you need to do:

  • Create a Static List in Marketo to hold subscribers
  • Create a Form CTA to collect subscribers, attach your Static List to it, and place the Form CTA in the Stream you want to allow visitors to subscribe to
  • Get the Stream's RSS feed
  • Use the RSS Feed to create a Digest in Digesto
  • Create a Program in Marketo dedicated to Digesto
  • Configure the Smart Campaign in the Digesto-specific Program to send emails to subscribers

Each of these steps is described in more detail below.

Note

For simplicity, all of the instructions in this article describe how to set up Digesto for use with one Stream in your Uberflip Hub, but you can set up Digesto with as many Streams as you want.

The setup process is largely identical for additional Streams after your first one, with a few small tweaks. At the end of this article, you'll find an additional section that details what you need to keep in mind when you add Digesto functionality to further Streams.

 

Prerequisite: Set Up Required Integrations

Digesto is a Marketo app, so you need to integrate Digesto with your Marketo account before you can begin using it (with Uberflip, or elsewhere).

You can find instructions on how to do that in this article from Digesto:

Digesto: Connect your Marketo account to Digesto via REST API

This also means that, to use Digesto with your Uberflip Hub, your Hub needs to be integrated with your Marketo account. Before you can proceed, you'll need to set up this integration if you have not yet done so.

For detailed instructions on how to set up a Marketo integration with your Hub, see this article:

Set Up a Marketo Integration

 

Step 1: Create a Static List for Subscribers

To hold the email addresses (and other details) of visitors who want to subscribe to a Stream, you need to create a new Static List in Marketo. You will later connect this Static List to your Form CTA in Uberflip. As with all Marketo Lists that you use with Uberflip, you must create this List in the Lead Database section (not under Marketing Activities).

For instructions on how to create a Static List in Marketo, see this article from Marketo:

Marketo: Create a Static List

 

Step 2: Create a Form CTA

You'll collect subscribers to the Stream using a Form CTA. Create a new Form CTA for use with Digesto, and make sure that it is:

  • Connected to Marketo
  • Attached to the Static List you created in the previous step
  • Only has one placement: an At Stream Level placement within the Stream you want to allow visitors to subscribe to

See the following article for instructions on how to create and configure the Form CTA:

Set Up a Form CTA

 

Step 3: Get the Stream's RSS Feed

Digesto knows when new content has been added to a Stream by monitoring its RSS feed. As a result, you'll need to get the RSS feed for the Stream that you want to let your visitors subscribe to.

Within your Hub, each individual Stream has its own RSS feed, and you can also get a Hub-wide RSS feed that covers content across all Streams (by default, the Latest Content Items on your Hub homepage). Expand the relevant section below for instructions on how to find the desired type of RSS feed:

Get the RSS feed for a Hub (Latest Content)
  1. Log in to Uberflip and navigate to the Hub you want to work with.
  2. In the top left corner, click on (RSS) next to the Hub favicon and name:
    • Make sure to click on (RSS), not the domain of the Hub (which appears right next to it).
  3. The RSS feed for the Hub will open in a new tab, with a URL like this: https://hub.mywebsite.com/h/feed.rss
  4. This URL represents the RSS feed for the entire Hub. Copy this URL so that you can use it in Digesto later.

Note

If the Replace Home Page with a Marketing Stream setting (Under Hub Options > Advanced) is being used, the Hub's RSS feed will include only Items that are in the selected Marketing Stream and are not hidden.

To get a Hub-level RSS feed that contains Items across all Streams, change this setting back to Latest Content (note that this will still only include non-hidden Items).

Get the RSS feed for a single Stream
  1. Log in to Uberflip and navigate to the Hub you want to work with.
  2. Open the Stream for which you want to get the RSS feed under the Content section.
  3. While viewing the Stream, click on RSS in the top right corner:
  4. The RSS feed for the Stream will open in a new tab, with a URL like this: https://hub.mywebsite.com/streamname.rss
  5. This URL represents the RSS feed for the selected Stream. Copy this URL so that you can use it in Digesto later.

 

Step 4: Create a Digest in Digesto

Now that you have the RSS feed you need, you can set up the Digest for this Stream in Digesto. Digests are the actual emails that will be sent out to subscribers to notify them of new content in the Stream. As part of creating a Digest, you will specify which RSS feed it should monitor (i.e. the one you just got from your Hub), as well as options like what the email will look like, the schedule on which it is sent, etc.

For detailed instructions on how to create a Digest, see this article from Digesto:

Digesto: Create your first Digest

 

Step 5: Create a Dedicated Marketo Program

Digesto requires a dedicated Program in Marketo, so you'll need to create this Program next.

The Digesto-specific Program needs to be configured in a specific way. To create this Program in Marketo, follow the instructions in this article from Digesto:

Digesto: Create a dedicated Marketo program

 

Step 6: Configure Smart Campaigns in Marketo

Almost done! As part of setting up the dedicated Marketo Program for Digesto in the previous step, you will have created two Smart Campaigns: one for testing, and one for production. What you need to do now is configure these Smart Campaigns so that they specifically email subscribers to your Stream (technically, you only need to configure the production Smart Campaign in this way, but we strongly recommending testing your setup first using the testing Smart Campaign).

  1. Begin by setting up the Smart Campaigns as described in Step 4 of the Digesto article.
  2. Under the Smart List section, add a single Member of List filter, and configure it as follows:

    (For Digesto Subscribers, substitute the Static List you created in Step 1.)
  3. Continue to configure the Smart Campaign (i.e. Flow, Schedule, etc.) as described in the Digesto article.

That's it! The Smart Campaign is now set up in such a way that any visitor who submits the Form CTA on the Stream you chose will be added to the Static List, and will therefore be automatically pulled in to the Smart List on the campaign. The campaign will trigger the Digesto Digest, which will be emailed to your subscribers according to the schedule you set up in Digesto.

 

Configure Digesto for Additional Streams

All of the steps above describe how to set up Digesto to notify subscribers of updates to just one Stream, but you can allow visitors to subscribe to any number of separate Streams in your Hub.

For each additional Stream that you want enable Digesto on, simply repeat the steps above, with the following adjustments:

  • Step 1: Create a new, separate Static List for each individual Stream. As a best practice, give these Static Lists descriptive names that will help you find them later (such as "XYZ Stream for Digesto").
  • Step 2: Create a separate Form CTA for each Stream, and associate it with the Static List dedicated to that Stream's subscribers.
  • Step 3: Get the Stream's RSS feed as usual.
  • Step 4: Digests can only be associated with one RSS feed, so you will need to set up separate Digests in Digesto for each individual Stream.
  • Step 5: You do not need to create separate Digesto-specific Programs in Marketo for additional Streams. Instead, add a new Smart Campaign to the existing Program for each Stream you want to add.
  • Step 6: When you configure the Smart Campaign, make sure to set up the Smart List to pull in subscribers from the Stream-specific Static List you created in Step 1.

articles.name: Internal: Set Up an Oktopost Integration
articles.title: Internal: Set Up an Oktopost Integration
articles.body:
Objective

Integrate with Oktopost to send data from Uberflip Form CTAs to Oktopost.

Important Note

The conversion will not be sent to Oktopost unless navigating to the gated Uberflip item via the Oktopost tracker link (that redirects to the gated asset).

Get Oktopost Tracking Code

Before you can integrate your Hub with Oktopost, you will need to get your tracking code from Oktopost. For instructions, see this article from Oktopost:

Oktopost: Setting Up Conversion Tracking and Lead Capture

 

Create Custom Code Blocks for Oktopost

  1. Navigate to your Hub's Custom Code section via the following link: https://app.uberflip.com/hubs/custom_code
  2. Create a code block by clicking the "+Add Code" button
  3. Name code block "Oktopost Tracking Code"
  4. [if required] Add code block to a privacy group
  5. Switch to the "Code" tab
  6. Switch placement to "Head"
  7. Paste in the code supplied by Oktopost (with your unique identifier). It should look like the code below (make sure to use your own tracking code, not this example):
    <script>
    (function(a, b, c, d, e, m) {
     a['OktopostTrackerObject'] = d;
     a[d] = a[d] || function() {
     (a[d].q = a[d].q || []).push(arguments);
     };
     e = b.createElement('script');
     m = b.getElementsByTagName('script')[0];
     e.async = 1;
     e.src = ('https:' === document.location.protocol ? 'https://' : 'http://') + c;
     m.parentNode.insertBefore(e, m);
    })(window, document, 'static.oktopost.com/oktrk.js', '_oktrk');

    _oktrk('create', '{UNIQUE-IDENTIFIER-HERE}');
    </script>
  8. Save code block
  9. Return to Custom Code section: https://app.uberflip.com/hubs/custom_code
  10. Create a new code block
  11. Name code block "Oktopost Conversion Tracking Code"
  12. Switch to the "Code" tab
  13. Switch placement to "Body Bottom"
  14. Copy the code below and paste into code block:
    <script type="text/javascript">
    (function($,Hubs, undefined){

    Hubs.Events.on('ctaFormSubmitSuccess', function(ctaId, mappedData, ctaName) { 
    oktopostTracker(mappedData); 
    })

    function oktopostTracker(mappedData){

    _oktrk('send', {
     tag: 'Uberflip',
     firstName: mappedData['firstName'],
     lastName: mappedData['lastName'],
     email: mappedData['email'],
     company: mappedData['company']
     });
    }
    }(window.jQuery, window.Hubs));
    </script>
  15. Save code block
  16. Return to Custom Code section: https://app.uberflip.com/hubs/custom_code
  17. Enable both code blocks by toggling them on
  18. The setup is complete, and Form CTA submissions will now be sent to Oktopost

articles.name: Internal: Use Dubsplat to Identify Reverse Proxy Setup Issues
articles.title: Internal: Use Dubsplat to Identify Reverse Proxy Setup Issues
articles.body:
If you are helping a customer to set up a Hub on a subdirectory ("Hubs on Dubs"), this guide describes how to troubleshoot the customer's reverse proxy setup by using the Dubsplat debugging tool.

 

Before You Begin

  • This document is for internal use only. Please do not share it with customers or anyone else outside of Uberflip.
  • This guide is intended for Uberflippers who are helping a customer to set up a custom domain on a subdirectory. In most cases, this would be a CSM, an Onboarding Specialist, or a Solutions Engineer.
  • This guide is intended to complement the Hubs on Subdirectories setup guide, which you can find here.

 

A Quick Dubsplat Primer

What is Dubsplat?

Dubsplat is a debugging tool. It looks for common problems in Hubs that are served over a reverse proxy. Hubs that use a subdirectory custom domain (i.e. "Hubs on Dubs") must use a reverse proxy, so Dubsplat is primarily intended for this type of Hub. However, it will also work on Hubs that use a regular subdomain custom domain, or the default co-branded sub-domain.

How Does Dubsplat Work?

When a browser visits a Hub, it sends an HTTP request message to the Hub, and the Hub sends back a response message with the requested content. The main difference with a Hubs on Dubs Hub is that these messages need to pass through a proxy server that sits between the browser and the Hub.

Ideally, we want the proxy to pass the messages between the browser and the Hub unchanged. Most Hubs on Dubs issues happen when the proxy makes changes to these messages, so Dubsplat works by identifying if (and how) this is happening.

Dubsplat compares the request and response messages before and after they pass through the proxy, looking for differences. It does this by first sending requests to the Hub and receiving the returning responses, just like a normal browser. This forms the baseline: Dubsplat now knows what both the original request messages and the response messages from the server looked like.

To make a comparison, Dubsplat also needs to know what the server actually received, and what it sent back. To get this information, Dubsplat sends its requests to a special @debugging endpoint that exists in every Hub.

Whenever the @debugging endpoint receives a request, it simply sends back a packet of data (a JSON object) that tells Dubsplat what the request message looked like when it arrived in the Hub, and what the Hub sent back in the response message:

Dubsplat now knows what it sent and what the Hub actually received; and what the Hub sent back and what Dubsplat actually received. If there are any discrepancies, we can assume that they were likely caused the reverse proxy, so Dubsplat flags them as potential issues with the way the reverse proxy is set up.

Tip

If you want, you can access the @debugging endpoint manually — it's always located in the root directory of a subdomain Hub, or the subdirectory of a Hubs on Dubs Hub:

  • https://hub.uberflip.com/@debugging

  • https://www.uberflip.com/culture/@debugging

Requesting this endpoint in your browser will display the JSON object that it returns (Firefox will format this nicely; other browsers will just return the raw data). You can see what this looks like in the screenshot above.

The same information is actually also included in Uberflip's error pages, such as our 404 page. The difference is that, on these pages, it's part of the HTML of the page, rather than a JSON object. This difference in format helps Dubsplat to figure out if a request is reaching Uberflip, but is being sent to an error page rather than an actual Hub.

How Does Dubsplat Help to Identify Reverse Proxy Issues?

HTTP request and response messages mainly consist of a list of parameters (header fields) and values. When we talk about a reverse proxy changing these messages, this generally means that it is modifying a value, or simply deleting a parameter altogether.

If the reverse proxy is altering any parameter, there is usually a corresponding setting in the reverse proxy that controls this behaviour. Troubleshooting the reverse proxy configuration is therefore a matter of figuring out exactly what is being changed, then identifying the setting responsible and adjusting it.

Dubsplat helps with this by flagging specific instances where parameters have been changed or are missing, with a particular focus on parameters that will either break Hub functionality or make the entire Hub inaccessible. Armed with this information, you can then help the customer identify the root cause (i.e. the corresponding setting), allowing them to make the necessary changes. As a bonus, Dubsplat is also able to flag miscellaneous configuration issues, such as problems with SSL or DNS.

 

Use Dubsplat to Troubleshoot a Hub

  • You can use Dubsplat with any Hub — all you need is the Hub's main URL.
  • As noted above, Dubsplat is primarily intended for Hubs on subdirectory custom domains, and will be most useful when used with this type of Hub.
  • While you can use Dubsplat at any time, it is mainly designed to test reverse proxy setups, so it is best used once the customer has fully set up their reverse proxy. The appropriate time to use this tool is indicated in the Hubs on Subdirectories setup guide.

Step 1: Run a Test

  1. To begin, open Dubsplat by visiting this URL: https://dubsplat.herokuapp.com/
  2. Enter the URL for the Hub you want to test into the URL field. This must be the URL for the homepage of the Hub, and must also include the protocol (http/https). For example:
    • Incorrect: www.customer.com/hub/
    • Correct: https://www.customer.com/hub/
  3. Click the Test button to begin the test.
  4. Dubsplat will run the test, and will return a results page. This should only take a few seconds.

Step 2: Review Results & Advise Customer

When the test has completed, Dubsplat will display the results page. This page will contain one or more messages, and each message corresponds to a specific issue that Dubsplat has identified. These messages point out problems which require action by the customer to resolve.

There are four types of message:

  • Success: This message will appear by itself, and indicates that Dubsplat did not find problems in any of the areas it is able to test. This means the reverse proxy is most likely set up correctly.
  • Testing Failed: These messages will appear when Dubsplat was unable to connect, and therefore could not complete testing.
  • Warning: These messages indicate that Dubsplat connected to the specified URL, but something went wrong and Dubsplat could not identify the exact problem.
  • Error: Messages of this type signal that Dubsplat identified a specific problem with the reverse proxy setup (reverse proxy is making an unwanted change).

Each message (except for the Success message) contains:

  • A brief description of the problem that Dubsplat identified
  • An explanation of what this means, including what Dubsplat tried to test, how it went wrong, and common reasons why this issue occurs
  • Suggestions for how the customer can fix the problem

Review the results, then advise the customer as needed on identified issues and possible fixes. Because there are many different types of reverse proxy software and we can't directly support them all, the solutions provided are mostly general. However, a representative on the customer side who is reasonably knowledgeable about their reverse proxy should be able to use these as a starting point for the specific steps they need to take.

Step 3: Repeat

Once the customer has made any needed changes, run the test on Dubsplat again. Continue to repeat this process until all issues have been resolved, and Dubsplat displays the Success message.

articles.name: Internal: Can a Hub have two domains?
articles.title: Internal: Can a Hub have two domains?
articles.body:
Question

Can you associate a single Hub with two separate domains?

 

Answer
